description: From Middle French sédiment, from Latin sedimentum < sedeō.

entries.meaning: A collection of small particles, particularly dirt, that precipitates from a river or other body of water.
examples: The Nile delta is composed of sediment that was washed down and deposited at the mouth of the river.

verbs.description: sediment (third-person singular simple present sediments, present participle sedimenting, simple past and past participle sedimented)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To deposit material as a sediment.
(intransitive) To be deposited as a sediment.
